H0.text: It codes for proteins, enabling DNA in the nucleus to control the functioning of the cell.

H1.text: It inhibits division of cells is how DNA in the nucleus controls the working of the cell.

H2.text: It helps in energy transformation, describing how DNA controls the working of the cell in the nucleus that contains DNA.

H3.text: It regulates traffic in and out of the cell is how DNA controls the working of the cell, as the nucleus contains DNA.

A4.text: DNA makes RNA, and RNA makes protein

A5.text: Transcription is the process by which the information contained in a section of DNA is replicated in the form of a newly assembled piece of messenger RNA (mRNA).
